Recent articles in the Kaimin repeat the Mask Mantra about responsibility and unselfishness while ignoring the legitimate concern raised by thoughtful objectors

When do the masks come off

When its over Diseases like this persist for years or can even become permanent PERIOD When theres a cure Theres no cure to the common cold yet we expect one for this plague PERIOD When the experts say so They routinely provide conflicting information amid increasingly vicious politics PERIOD

The point is that none of these scenarios truly end PERIOD Combined with an unprecedented amount of highly restrictive measures we are giving a blank check to our rulers power that once given is seldom reacquired PERIOD

Yet dissenters to this panicinduced surrender of liberty are publicly shamed PERIOD You are selfish and irresponsible for objecting  even when decrying the horrible damage these restrictive measures themselves have caused PERIOD

My friend caught an easilycurable infection and was nearly turned away because she had a COVIDlike fever PERIOD This false alarm could have killed her PERIOD Many thousands have killed themselves in despair at the loss of control in their lives PERIOD Millions more continue to suffer the loss of their businesses livelihoods and sociability caused by measures without foreseeable end nor limit to their indignities PERIOD

Now we should not spit in each others mouths in protest PERIOD Instead we should have some serious conversation about how far is too far when it comes to surrendering ones rights in the face of siegelike anxiety PERIOD Dont be stupid or selfrighteous  just dont mask the issue PERIOD

Garret Morill
